isis.stitle: CAB: 5000i AND 9000i CONVENTIONAL - REMOVE - CAB AIR RIDE System for 9200i/9400i/9900i DAY CAB MODELS WITHOUT DETROIT DIESEL ENGINES before DECEMBER 2001

svcproc.title: CAB AIR RIDE System for 9200 i/9400 i/9900 i DAY CAB MODELS WITHOUT DETROIT DIESEL ENGINES before DECEMBER 2001

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 105 for Items in parentheses.

The cab air ride system for 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i day cab models without Detroit Diesel engines before December 2001 contains two air springs (bags) (Item 1), two shock absorbers (Items 2 and 3), and is controlled by the cab air ride valve assembly (Item 4). The air ride components are not interchangeable with different cab models.

The following components - nylon air lines (to air spring) (Item 5), elbow fittings (Item 6 and 7), tee fitting (Item 8), air springs (bags) (Item 1), cab air ride valve assembly (Item 4), shock absorbers (Items 2 and 3) and track bar rod (Item 9) - should be checked at the time the truck is being serviced. Immediate corrective action should be taken if a malfunction occurs.

note.para: The height control valve (Item 4), air springs (bags) (Item 1) and shock absorbers (Items 2 and 3) are serviceable and can be replaced individually.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Air Ride Shock Absorber
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 105 for Items in parentheses.

step2.para: Remove two hex head screw sems assemblies (Item 10) at the top of shock absorber (Item 3).
Remove hex flanged lock nut (Item 11) and two flat washers (Item 12) at the bottom of the shock absorber (Item 3).

Pull top of shock absorber (Item 3) out from under air suspension upper mounting plate (Item 13) and lift bottom shaft of shock absorber with flat washer (Item 14) and spacer (Item 15) out of shock absorber mounting hole in air suspension lower mounting plate (Item 16).
Remove two hex head screw sems assemblies (Item 10) at the top of shock absorber (Item 2).
Remove two hex head screw sems assemblies (Item 10) at the bottom of shock absorber (Item 2).
Pull shock absorber (Item 2) from between air suspension upper mounting plate (Item 13) and air suspension lower mounting plate (Item 16).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Air Ride Air Springs (Bags)

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from the air system, be sure air system is drained and be sure to set parking brake and/or block vehicle wheels to prevent it from moving while service is being performed.

step1.para: Unlatch hood on both sides and open hood to full tilt position.

caution.para: If the cab has to be jacked up (lifted) for service of air ride components, it is recommended that the hood assembly be tilted to the fully open position and is supported on an appropriate floor stand. This will eliminate any possible damage to the hood.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 105 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Press and hold release button against fitting body and pull push to connect elbow fitting (Item 6) and nylon air line (to air spring) (Item 5) from the bottom of passenger side air spring (bag) (Item 1).
Press and hold release button against fitting body and pull push to connect tee fitting (Item 8) and nylon air lines (to air spring) (Item 5) from the bottom of driver side air spring (bag) (Item 1).
Remove push-on ring (Item 17) at the top stud of both air springs (bags) (Item 1).
Carefully raise cab for enough clearance to remove air springs (bags) (Item 1) as follows.
Use a suitable jack placed on frame rail flange and back of cab floor frame (Figure 106).

figure.caption: Figure 106. Place Jack on Frame Rail Flange and Back of Cab Floor Frame

step1.para: Once the jack is positioned properly, carefully raise cab for enough clearance to remove top stud of air springs (bags) (Item 1) from air suspension upper mounting plate (Item 13).

caution.para: Over-raising of cab may cause component damage.

step1.para: Once the cab has been raised, remove push-on ring (Item 17) at the bottom stud of both air springs (bags) (Item 1).
Remove air springs (bags) (Item 1) from between air suspension upper mounting plate (Item 13) and air suspension lower mounting plate (Item 16).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Track Bar Rod
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 105 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove track bar rod (Item 9) as follows.

step2.para: Remove hex flanged head bolt (Item 19) and hex flanged lock nut (Item 20) from track bar mount bracket (Item 18) and track bar rod (Item 9).
Remove hex flanged head bolt (Item 21) and hex lock nut (Item 22) from track bar mount of air suspension upper mounting plate (Item 13) and track bar rod (Item 9) and remove track bar rod.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Air Ride Valve

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from air system, be sure to set parking brake and/or block vehicle wheels to prevent it from moving while service is being performed.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 107 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Press and hold release button against fitting body and pull air line (supply) (Item 1) from push to connect elbow fitting (Item 8) of cab air ride valve (Item 2).
Press and hold release button against fitting body and pull push to connect elbow fitting (Item 8) from bottom of cab air ride valve (Item 2).
Remove cotter pin (Item 3) and flat washer (Item 4) from vertical adjuster rod (Item 5) and remove vertical adjuster rod from nyliner bushing (Item 6) and bracket (Item 7).

Remove two hex head bolts, flat washers and hex lock nuts (Items 10, 11 and 12) and remove cab air ride valve (Item 2) from track bar mount bracket (Item 9). Save cab air ride valve, unless being replaced, and hex head bolts, flat washers and hex lock nuts for installation.
